content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very well made
How do I approve your contribution?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: i like it
Please change the input from JSON. I suggest using CSV which is more easily parsed.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'accepte cette contribution parce que je n'ai jamais vu d'autre test comme celui-ci et c'est très intéressant.
I like the idea ! But may the JSON inputs give too much advantage to languages that have built-in JSON parser ?

It could be see like that but here are why I still prefer to leave this contribution like that:
- most of languages used by the community have a Json parser
- not using Json will change the exercice or make it more difficult to understand (I can develop this part if you don't get my point)
- peoples are familiar with Json and it has the same standardization in all countries 

More than that, sure it's not fair for language that doesn't have a Json parser but the question is the same with all challenge, for exemple python with math is much more capable than some other language, to my mind it's almost impossible to have a fair challenge when you mix languages in clash.

Best
